title.value: UPSC Quiz- 2018 : Wisdom Academy Daily Quiz [Day 002]

body.value:
UPSC Quiz- 2018 : Wisdom Academy Daily Quiz [Day 002] - Budget 2017-18 

 

 

Q.1) It’s 200 years since the army led by King of Khurda revolted against the British on April 2, 1817.Regarding this revolt consider the following statements:

1. It took place when the British East India company wrested the rent-free land that had been given to the Paiks for their military service to the Kingdom of Khurda

2.  At that critical juncture, BakshiJagabandhuBidyadhar — the military chief of the King of Khurda — led his motley army of Paikas forcing the British East India Company forces to retreat. The rebellion came to be known as PaikaBidroh (Paika rebellion).

3. When the British started tinkering with the revenue system in 1803, the farming community of Assam rose in rebellion.

Which of the above is/are correct statements

Select the correct answer using the codes given below.

(a) 1 only

(b) 1 and 2 only

(c) 1 and 3 only

(d) 1, 2 and 3

Q.2)  In line with its promise to clean up the political funding system, the Centre on unveiled the contours of the ‘Electoral Bonds’ scheme, which seeks to ensure the flow of clean money to political parties, without revealing the donors’ names. Regarding this consider the following statements:

.1. A citizen of India or a body incorporated in India will be eligible to purchase the bond from specified branches of the State Bank of India.

.2. The bonds can be purchased for any value in multiples of ₹1,000; ₹10,000; ₹1 lakh; ₹10 lakh; and ₹1 crore, he said.

3. To benefit from the electoral bonds scheme, the political parties must have been registered with the Election Commission and should have secured not less than 3 per cent of the votes polled in the most recent General Election to the LokSabha or a State legislative assembly.

Which of the given abovestatements is/are correct?

Select the correct answer using the codes given below.

(a) 1 only

(b) 1 and 2 only

(c) 1 and 3 only

(d) 1, 2 and 3

Q3) “Operation Greens” recentaly in news was regarding about

(a) large plantation drive.

(B) its part of eco friendly fuel policy

(c) to increase solar energy efficiency

(d) to address price fluctuations vegetables

Q4) To step up investments in research and related infrastructure in premier educational institutions, including health institutions, a major initiative  by 2022 with a total investment of Rs.1,00,000 crore in next four years was announced.Which is that initiative

(a) INSPIRE

(b) STRIVE

(c) RISE

(d) GAIN

Q5) The Budget proposes to expand the airport capacity more than five times to handle a billion trips a year under a new initiative named this

(a) NABH Nirman.

(b) UDAN (UdeDeshkaAamNagrik)

(c) AAKASH

(d) none of the above

 

Click here for answers...

UPSC Quiz- 2018 : Wisdom Academy Daily Quiz [Day 002] - Budget 2017-18 

 

 

Q.1) It’s 200 years since the army led by King of Khurda revolted against the British on April 2, 1817.Regarding this revolt consider the following statements:

1. It took place when the British East India company wrested the rent-free land that had been given to the Paiks for their military service to the Kingdom of Khurda

2.  At that critical juncture, BakshiJagabandhuBidyadhar — the military chief of the King of Khurda — led his motley army of Paikas forcing the British East India Company forces to retreat. The rebellion came to be known as PaikaBidroh (Paika rebellion).

3. When the British started tinkering with the revenue system in 1803, the farming community of Assam rose in rebellion.

Which of the above is/are correct statements

Select the correct answer using the codes given below.

(a) 1 only

(b) 1 and 2 only

(c) 1 and 3 only

(d) 1, 2 and 3

Q.2)  In line with its promise to clean up the political funding system, the Centre on unveiled the contours of the ‘Electoral Bonds’ scheme, which seeks to ensure the flow of clean money to political parties, without revealing the donors’ names. Regarding this consider the following statements:

.1. A citizen of India or a body incorporated in India will be eligible to purchase the bond from specified branches of the State Bank of India.

.2. The bonds can be purchased for any value in multiples of ₹1,000; ₹10,000; ₹1 lakh; ₹10 lakh; and ₹1 crore, he said.

3. To benefit from the electoral bonds scheme, the political parties must have been registered with the Election Commission and should have secured not less than 3 per cent of the votes polled in the most recent General Election to the LokSabha or a State legislative assembly.

Which of the given abovestatements is/are correct?

Select the correct answer using the codes given below.

(a) 1 only

(b) 1 and 2 only

(c) 1 and 3 only

(d) 1, 2 and 3

Q3) “Operation Greens” recentaly in news was regarding about

(a) large plantation drive.

(B) its part of eco friendly fuel policy

(c) to increase solar energy efficiency

(d) to address price fluctuations vegetables

Q4) To step up investments in research and related infrastructure in premier educational institutions, including health institutions, a major initiative  by 2022 with a total investment of Rs.1,00,000 crore in next four years was announced.Which is that initiative

(a) INSPIRE

(b) STRIVE

(c) RISE

(d) GAIN

Q5) The Budget proposes to expand the airport capacity more than five times to handle a billion trips a year under a new initiative named this

(a) NABH Nirman.
